result.execSummary:
The defendant Demonte T Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No DNA sample or DNA surcharge  ordered on this case as it has been ordered on case 14CF3487.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packet
Notice mailed to surety for bail refund. JM

Defendant Demonte T Tatum in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.

- No DNA sample or DNA surcharge ordered on this case as it has been ordered on case 14CF3487.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Demonte T Tatum in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demonte T Tatum in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Final pre-trial conference held.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Defense counsel requests projected plea date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and jury trial in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
